intro: Cleistopholis patens var. klaineana, commonly known as the Klainea hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. The leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, while the stems are woody and can reach several meters in height.
